description: From Late Latin vīlificāre, present active infinitive of vīlificō (“vilify”).

verbs.description: vilify (third-person singular simple present vilifies, present participle vilifying, simple past and past participle vilified)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To say defamatory things about someone or something; to speak ill of.
examples: Synonyms: abuse, assail, criticize, decry, denigrate, demonize, denounce, libel, revile, slander, run down; see also Thesaurus:defame

entries.meaning: (transitive) To belittle through speech; to put down.
